contentrichtext.text: {{korean name|[[Kim (Korean name)|Kim]]}} {{Infobox Korean name |hangul=김용산 |hanja=金用山 |rr=Gim Yong-san |mr=Kim Yong-san }} '''Kim Yong-san''' (October 13, 1922 – July 14, 2007) was a [[Korea]]n businessman. He was born in [[Siheung]], [[Gyeonggi]] province.<ref>{{cite web|author=고객센터 |url=http://people.nate.com/people/info/ki/my/kimyongsn/ |title=네이트 인물검색 |publisher=People.nate.com |date=2007-07-15 |accessdate=2010-01-22}}</ref> He is a pioneer in the industrialization of South Korea, specifically the construction business. In 1948 he founded the [[Kukdong Business Group]], one of the largest construction companies in South Korea.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hankyung.com/news/app/newsview.php?aid=2007071549651&sid=0106&nid=006&ltype=1 |title=김용산 前극동건설 회장 별세 |publisher=hankyung |language=Korean |date= |accessdate=2010-01-22}}</ref> His company has built many famous projects which include; [[Petronas Twin Towers|KLCC Building]] in [[Kuala Lumpur]] (currently the third tallest building in the world), Korea World Trade Center, as well as many other projects, both domestically and internationally. ==See also== *[[Hyundai]] * [[Economy of South Korea]] * [[List of Korea-related topics]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Kim, Yong-san | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1922 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 2007 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kim, Yong-san}} [[Category:1922 births]] [[Category:2007 deaths]] [[Category:South Korean businesspeople]] {{Korea-bio-stub}}
